ygData.subject: Re: Interesting Benefit of Charismatic Carralion
ygData.msgSnippet: The way I think is this. You need a certain faction level to get a ring from the Sherrif. Getting one drops your faction so you can t just stand there handing
ygData.messageBody:
The way I think is this. You need a certain faction level to get a ring
from the Sherrif. Getting one drops your faction so you can't just stand
there handing them out and asking the sherrif for a new one.

I heard a rumor that back in Beta you had to turn the ring into the cleric
and go back to the sherrif to ask for another ring. Thus when you turned the
ring in, your faction had to be raised enough for the sherrif to give you a
new one. If you were to lose the ring, sell it, or turn it in to the wrong
person, you had to prove your worthiness again by taking out a few more
goblins/orcs.

Now that the cleric recharges it and hands it back to you, I don't know
what the faction adjustment would be for.

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)

8)On Fri, 4 Jun 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
8)>
8)> so the next question would obviously be Why aren't people
8)> selling these things [squad rings]? I would think they
8)> would bring a hefty bit o change.
8)
8)Like I said, the guy on the monk list claimed every time you
8)get a new ring, you lose faction and have to kill more goblins
8)and orcs to qualify for another ring.
8)
8)I'll add that you *gain* faction for recharging the ring.
8)Odd.
8)
